answerText: Turing machine[10] This much weaker computational model consists of a set of states and by definition only accepts regular languages. One can interconvert between its deterministic and nondeterministic types.
heading: ACF Regionals |2013 | Bellarmine + Chicago A | 11 | Science | Computer Science | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] This model consists of an infinite tape whose cells are edited by a read/write head. According to a thesis of Church and its namesake, this model is sufficiently powerful to capture the intuitive notion of computability.
